intro: Erigerodes pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf erigeron, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky environments. The plant produces delicate, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers, typically blooming in spring. It has a compact growth habit, with small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil.
